qas.question: During which year did Victoria's mother die?

answers.text: their son, the Prince of Wales

qas.question: What gossip did Prince Albert hear about their son?

answers.text: had slept with an actress in Ireland

qas.question: During which year did Victoria's mother live?
How did Victoria realize that her mother slightly loved her?
What wasn't Albert ill with?
What wasn't Princess of Wales attending to in Dublin?
What didn't Victoria blame Albert's death on?

context: In <a10_0>March <a0_0><a5_0><a15_0><b20_0>1861<b20_0/><a15_0/><a10_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>, Victoria's mother died, with Victoria at her side. <a1_0><b21_0>Through reading her mother's papers<b21_0/><a1_0/>, Victoria discovered that her mother had loved her deeply; she was heart-broken, and blamed <a6_0><a16_0>Conroy and Lehzen<a16_0/><a6_0/> for "wickedly" estranging her from her mother. To relieve his wife during her intense and deep grief, <a7_0>Albert<a7_0/> took on most of her duties, despite being ill himself with <a2_0><a8_0><b22_0>chronic stomach trouble<b22_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/>. In August, Victoria and Albert visited <a18_0>their son, the Prince of Wales<a18_0/>, who was attending <a3_0>army manoeuvres<a3_0/> near Dublin, and spent a few days holidaying in Killarney. In November, Albert was made aware of gossip that his son <a19_0>had slept with <a14_0>an actress in Ireland<a19_0/><a14_0/>. Appalled, Albert travelled to Cambridge, where his son was studying, to confront him. By the beginning of December, Albert was very unwell. He was diagnosed with <a11_0><a17_0>typhoid fever<a17_0/><a11_0/> by William Jenner, and died on <a12_0>14 December <a9_0>1861<a12_0/><a9_0/>. Victoria was devastated. She blamed her husband's death on worry over the <a4_0><b23_0><b24_0>Prince of Wales's philandering<b24_0/><b23_0/><a4_0/>. He had been "killed by that dreadful business", she said. She entered a state of mourning and wore black for the remainder of her life. She avoided public appearances, and rarely set foot in London in the following years. Her seclusion earned her the nickname "<a13_0>widow of Windsor<a13_0/>".
